text:
<@U1KFBBWG1|harrisob> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/harrisob/F2CRY4F97/nodesdk_quick_start.mp4|NodeSDK_quick_start.mp4> and commented: Short silent movie showing how using “readthedocs” to run a quick start self contained fabric environment based on three docker images running a sample node.js SDK application. 

some points to consider:
  — does not require cloning or downloading any fabric files
  — does not require vagrant
  — requires native docker (with docker compose)

initial_comment.comment:
Short silent movie showing how using “readthedocs” to run a quick start self contained fabric environment based on three docker images running a sample node.js SDK application. 

some points to consider:
  — does not require cloning or downloading any fabric files
  — does not require vagrant
  — requires native docker (with docker compose)

purpose: The purpose of this is to show developers’ most recent work. Keep checking back, the plan is to at absolute MINIMUM new playbacks every 2 weeks.
text: <@U0W7D64LC|markparz> set the channel purpose: The purpose of this is to show developers’ most recent work. Keep checking back, the plan is to at absolute MINIMUM new playbacks every 2 weeks.

Hi everyone, If you are looking for help to navigate Jira and see what the current prioritized list is for fabric at least from my view, please see the <#C0UJTTB5J|requirements> channel. I ask if there is something in your mind that is out of priority order, or simply missing in the near term, please bring it up in the <#C0UJTTB5J|requirements>  slack channel. I’m working to keep the list in order as best I can, but need your feedback as well to help rank these.

Very nice demo of the Gossip protocol by <@U0ZJZBJLF> <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qpFzZRNKKp0>  This demo demonstrates what Gossip will do and how performant it can be. In the demo you will see references to bootstrap peer and gossip peers. There are simply peers, bootstrap peer is a peer that is aware of other peers, which should essentially be any peer. The gossip peer is also any peer on the fabric. Thanks Yacov!!

attachments.title: Hyperledger fabric Gossip component demo

text: it would be great if anyone could upload the video to other website rather than youtube，the china GFW block the youtube:skull:

Are the developers of the BCCSP interfaces aware that Java has had these concepts and abstractions built into the language since... forever? Have a look at the Java Crypto Extensions API where the language defines the interfaces and implementors provide the underling services and implementations. It’s not perfect but worth taking some inspiration from

text: <@U2L9F7VL1> Yes for sure, is there something specific so far that you see going down a bad path? <@U0ZR63HLK> <@U1BC5A0F9> <@U0S5KF44D>
Thanks for these playbacks - it's nice to hear how things are going!
Are you also planning to post in a less ephemeral location? :)
<@U0MRY2LKY> I believe that the team is looking to create a youtube channel.
also, now that the wiki is live, they should be posted there

<@U0W7D64LC> no, not specifically just making sure you’re aware of it. The architecture of the Java language APIs have many years of maturity behind them and are widely used so probably a good place to seek inspiration. My only criticism of the proposed design is trying to throw everything into a single interface. That said, the JCE is VERY abstract so using it can be quite verbose. Perhaps a happy medium is the answer :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U2L9F7VL1> will soon get them on the wiki since youtube won’t work for all, thanks for the head’s up and reminder :wink:
<@U0W7D64LC> can you remind us which wiki?
<@U184J2R7S> yup will do as soon as I get it set up and content delivered. Chris mentioned it’s live, but the last TSC note still points to the old site, so verifying..
